body_html:
I was wrong. It's not a problem of python (somehow thought how that would even be related).

For me it works as follows:

export PYTHONPATH="${PYTHONPATH}:/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages:/home/martin/miniconda3/envs/caffe2/lib/python3.6/site-packages"

This way it loads torch from the first directory and torchvision from the miniconda installation.

Why this works... I don't know.

For me it works as follows:
export PYTHONPATH="${PYTHONPATH}:/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages:/home/martin/miniconda3/envs/caffe2/lib/python3.6/site-packages"

body:
I was wrong. It's not a problem of python (somehow thought how that would even be related).

For me it works as follows:

`export PYTHONPATH="${PYTHONPATH}:/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages:/home/martin/miniconda3/envs/caffe2/lib/python3.6/site-packages"` 

This way it loads `torch` from the first directory and `torchvision` from the miniconda installation.

Why this works... I don't know.
